content: First Cabinet of Singapore from 1959 to 1963 The **First Lee Kuan Yew Cabinet** was the [Cabinet of Singapore](/wiki/Cabinet_of_Singapore) from 5 June 1959 to 18 October 1963. The cabinet was led by [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew), who was elected as [prime minister](/wiki/1959_Singapore_PAP_Prime_Ministerial_Election). It was formed on 5 June 1959, after securing a landslide victory in the [1959 general election](/wiki/1959_Singaporean_general_election). A minor cabinet reshuffle was made on 24 September 1961. ## Cabinet The First Lee Kuan Yew Cabinet consisted of the following ministers.** PortfolioNameTerm startTerm end[Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore)[Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew)5 June 195918 October 1963[Deputy Prime Minister](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Singapore)[Toh Chin Chye](/wiki/Toh_Chin_Chye)5 June 195918 October 1963[Minister for National Development](/wiki/Ministry_of_National_Development_(Singapore))[Ong Eng Guan](/wiki/Ong_Eng_Guan)5 June 195920 June 1960[Toh Chin Chye](/wiki/Toh_Chin_Chye)[a]20 June 196025 August 1960[Tan Kia Gan](/wiki/Tan_Kia_Gan)25 August 196018 October 1963[Minister for Finance](/wiki/Ministry_of_Finance_(Singapore))[Goh Keng Swee](/wiki/Goh_Keng_Swee)5 June 195918 October 1963[Minister for Home Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Home_Affairs_(Singapore))[Ong Pang Boon](/wiki/Ong_Pang_Boon)5 June 195918 October 1963[Minister for Labour](/wiki/Ministry_of_Manpower_(Singapore))[Kenneth Michael Byrne](/wiki/Kenneth_Michael_Byrne)5 June 195924 September 1961[Ahmad Ibrahim](/wiki/Ahmad_Ibrahim_(Singaporean_politician))24 September 196121 August 1962[Ong Pang Boon](/wiki/Ong_Pang_Boon)[a]21 August 196218 October 1963[Minister for Law](/wiki/Minister_for_Law_(Singapore))[Kenneth Michael Byrne](/wiki/Kenneth_Michael_Byrne)5 June 195918 October 1963[Minister for Health](/wiki/Ministry_of_Health_(Singapore))[Ahmad Ibrahim](/wiki/Ahmad_Ibrahim_(Singaporean_politician))5 June 195924 September 1961[Kenneth Michael Byrne](/wiki/Kenneth_Michael_Byrne)24 September 196118 October 1963[Minister for Education](/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Singapore))[Yong Nyuk Lin](/wiki/Yong_Nyuk_Lin)5 June 195918 October 1963[Minister for Culture](/wiki/Ministry_of_Culture_(Singapore))[S. Rajaratnam](/wiki/S._Rajaratnam)5 June 195918 October 1963 **Notes**
